subject: Technology
title: Escape Velocity Explained
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Escape Velocity Explained.

hook.text: Throw a ball up and gravity pulls it back down. Throw it fast enough and it never comes back.

buildup.text: Escape velocity is the speed needed to break free from a planet's gravitational pull.

discovery.text: For Earth, escape velocity is about 25,000 mph. The Moon's is much lower because it has weaker gravity.

twist.text: You don't actually need to reach escape velocity all at once. Rockets accelerate gradually over minutes.

climax.text: Different planets require different escape speeds. Leaving Jupiter would need 134,000 mph.

punchline.text: To leave Earth, you must outrun its gravity at 25,000 mph.

quiz.question: What is Earth's approximate escape velocity?
